cover_letter.intro_para: I am interested in applying for a summer internship position at Skidmore, Owings and Merrill. After speaking with you over the phone this past summer, I became increasingly interested What did he say over the phone that really attracted you?in pursuing a job with your company. I have a strong interest in both architecture and structural engineering and I think I would be a great fit with the SOM culture and bring the necessary abilities to go above and beyond my job requirements.

para_background.experience: Growing up I was exceedingly interested in the study of architecture. However it was not until late in highschool that I realized that my interests were more technical in nature. Now in my fourth year at Northeastern University I am pursuing a master's degree in civil engineering with a focus in structural. I have taken courses in both the technical aspects of engineering and design as well as a class on the history of architecture in America. Formatting: extra closing accomplishments section
I gained technical communication skills from my work as a TA at Knowledge University. I often had to explain technical info in many different ways.

I have previous experience with AutoCAD, Revit, and other design programs from my previous work at Simpson, Gumpertz and Heger. closing_statements.compatability: I think I will fit in well with the holistic design culture of SOM.
closing_statements.next_step: I have attached my resume to this letter and I hope to hear from you in the future regarding possible opennings for interns in the Summer of 2017.

report.p:
Your background sections shows how you came to the conclusion that SOM would be a good fit for you. Maybe touch on how your desires play well into what SOM wants. For example, your interest in architecture combined with your technical expertise will allow you to be a crucial player in late-term project meetings where these two, commonly incompatible, goups have to meet (architects and structural engineers). Your ability in one field and your interest in the other sets you up well for upper management down the line as well as allows you to save the company money by not persuing one path initially with complete ignorance of the priorities of the other departments.
For a company, having someone that can act as a technical specialist and a communications asset is extremely valuable.
Comments on assignment will appear here.
